be.ac.umons.jsonschematools

Class JSONSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.ac.umons.jsonschematools.JSONSchema

  • public final class JSONSchema
extends Object
    A JSON schema stores the constraints a JSON document must satisfy to be valid. This class implements tools to manipulate a JSON schema:
    • Get the types allowed for the current schema. See Type.
    • Get the value associated to a key.
    • Get a sub-schema.
    • Merge multiple sub-schemas into a single schema, with all the constraints. See the non-API documentation for more information on merging the constraints given by multiples instances of a key.
    • Automatically follow $ref when encountered.
    Author:
    GaÃ«tan Staquet

    • Method Detail

      • depth

        public int depth()
          throws JSONSchemaException
        Computes the depth of the schema, i.e., the maximal number of nested objects. If the schema is recursive, the depth is infinite and this function does not return.
        Returns:
        The depth of the schema
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • getAdditionalProperties

        public JSONSchema getAdditionalProperties()
                                   throws JSONSchemaException
        Returns the schema describing the additional properties of this schema. If this schema does not describe an object, the returned schema is always false.
        Returns:
        The schema describing the additional properties
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • getAllKeysDefinedInSchema

        public Set<String> getAllKeysDefinedInSchema()
                                      throws JSONSchemaException
        Retrieves all the keys present in this schema. If the schema contains a sub-schema (due to properties, for instance), the answer will contain the keys from the sub-schema.
        Returns:
        A set containing all the keys defined in this schema.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • getAllowedTypes

        public List<Type> getAllowedTypes()
        Gets all the types that are allowed in this schema.
        Returns:
        A set containing all allowed types.

      • getForbiddenValues

        public Set<Object> getForbiddenValues()
        Gets all the values that are forbidden by this schema. For instance, the constraint "not": {"const": 5} imposes that 5 is a forbidden value.
        Returns:
        A set with the forbidden values.

      • getForbiddenValuesFilteredByType

        public <T> Set<T> getForbiddenValuesFilteredByType(Class<T> type)
        Gets all the values of the given type that are forbidden by this schema. This is equivalent to calling getForbiddenValues and only keeping the values with the correct type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type
        Parameters:
        type - A class instance for T
        Returns:
        A set with the filtered forbidden values.

      • getConstValue

        public Object getConstValue()
        Returns the const value defined in this schema. If the const value is not defined, returns null.
        Returns:
        The const value, or null

      • getConstValueIfType

        public <T> T getConstValueIfType(Class<T> type)
        Returns the const value defined in this schema, if the value's type matches the provided type. If the const value is not defined or is not an instance of the provided type, returns null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The required type
        Parameters:
        type - The required class
        Returns:
        The const value, or null

      • isEnum

        public boolean isEnum()
        Returns true if this schema allows the type ENUM.
        Returns:
        True if this schema allows the type ENUM.

        Returns true if this schema allows the type OBJECT.
        Returns:
        True if this schema allows the type OBJECT.

      • needsFurtherUnfolding

        public boolean needsFurtherUnfolding()
        Checks whether there are still some constraints in some sub-schemas that must be merged with the whole schema. When merging constraints from sub-schema defined in not, allOf, anyOf, or oneOf, it may happen that we end up with these keys again. In this case, we have to repeat the merging process to remove these keys. Note that the function may return false even if one of the above keys is still present, if the constraints inside the sub-schema can not be simplified by merging. These occurences must be handled explicitly by the generator or validator.
        Returns:
        true if there are constraints in sub-schemas that can be merged with this schema.

      • getRequiredPropertiesKeys

        public Set<String> getRequiredPropertiesKeys()
                                      throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets the keys that are required in this schema's properties.
        Returns:
        A set with the keys that are required
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If this schema does not allow the type OBJECT.

      • getRequiredProperties

        public Map<String,JSONSchema> getRequiredProperties()
                                             throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets the pairs key-value that are required by this schema.
        Returns:
        A map with the required keys, and their corresponding sub-schema.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If this schema does not allow the type OBJECT.

      • getNonRequiredProperties

        public Map<String,JSONSchema> getNonRequiredProperties()
                                                throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets the pairs key-value that are not required by this schema. The map contains the keys for additionalProperties and patternProperties, if they are allowed.
        Returns:
        A map with the non-required keys, and their corresponding sub-schema.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If this schema does not allow the type OBJECT.

      • dropAllOfAnyOfOneOfAndNot

        public JSONSchema dropAllOfAnyOfOneOfAndNot()
                                     throws JSONSchemaException
        Returns a copy of this schema without the sub-schemas for allOf, anyOf, oneOf, and not.
        Returns:
        A partial copy of this schema
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If it is not possible to construct a copy of this schema.

      • getAllOf

        public JSONSchema getAllOf()
                    throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets a single schema obtained by merging together all the sub-schemas in the allOf array. If there is no allOf key, the true schema is returned.
        Returns:
        A single schema containing all the constraints given in allOf.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • getAnyOf

        public List<JSONSchema> getAnyOf()
                          throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets a list containing one schema by element in the anyOf array. If there is no anyOf key, a singleton list containing the true schema is returned.
        Returns:
        A list of schemas, one by element in the allOf array.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • getOneOf

        public List<JSONSchema> getOneOf()
                          throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets a list containing one possible combination of the elements in the oneOf array, by applying the XOR operation. If oneOf contains the elements A, B, C, then this function produces three schemas:
        • {A, "not": B, "not": C}
        • {"not": A, B, "not": C}
        • {"not": A, "not": B, C}
        That is, the function applies the definition of XOR on the elements. If there is no oneOf key, returns a singleton list containing the true schema.
        Returns:
        A list of all possible combinations.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • merge

        public JSONSchema merge(JSONSchema other)
                 throws JSONSchemaException
        Merge this schema with an other schema. The keys of the final schema is the union of the keys from both schemas. Keys that are defined in both schemas are merged (see the non-API documentation to more information).
        Parameters:
        other - The other schema
        Returns:
        A single schema obtained by merging the two schemas
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If it is not possible to merge the schemas.

      • getRawNot

        public JSONSchema getRawNot()
                     throws JSONSchemaException
        Get the contents of the key not, without any modifications.
        Returns:
        The sub-schema contained in the key not.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If it is not possible to construct the sub-schema.

      • getNot

        public List<JSONSchema> getNot()
                        throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets a list of sub-schemas, after propagating the not inside each sub-schema. That is, if this schema contains "not": {A, B, C}, this function returns a list with three elements. Each element is obtained by applying the not inside A, B, and C, respectively. That is, it transforms a NOT AND into an OR NOT. If there is no not key, returns a singleton list with the true schema.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException

      • getSubSchemaProperties

        public JSONSchema getSubSchemaProperties(String key)
                                  throws org.json.JSONException,
                                         JSONSchemaException
        Gets the sub-schema for the property key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key inside the properties.
        Returns:
        The sub-schema.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If the properties sub-schema does not contain key.
        JSONSchemaException - If it is not possible to construct the sub-schema.

      • getSubSchema

        public JSONSchema getSubSchema(String key)
                        throws org.json.JSONException,
                               JSONSchemaException
        Gets the sub-schema for the key key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        Returns:
        The sub-schema.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If this schema does not contain key.
        JSONSchemaException - If it is not possible to construct the sub-schema.

      • getItemsArray

        public List<JSONSchema> getItemsArray()
                               throws JSONSchemaException
        Gets the sub-schemas for the items in an array.
        Returns:
        A list with the sub-schemas defining the items in an array.
        Throws:
        JSONSchemaException - If it is not possible to construct one of the sub-schemas.
